messages.content: In a Phase III, randomized, placebo‑controlled trial involving 2,260 adolescents aged 12–15 years, the BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine demonstrated 100 % efficacy against symptomatic COVID‑19, preventing all 18 confirmed cases in the vaccine arm while none occurred in the placebo group. Safety data indicated a favorable tolerability profile, supporting the use of the Pfizer‑BioNTech vaccine in younger populations.

The mRNA‑1273 vaccine (Moderna) was evaluated in a double‑blind, randomized Phase III trial of 30,351 adults. Two 100 µg doses administered four weeks apart yielded 94.1 % efficacy against symptomatic infection and conferred complete protection against severe disease. Immunogenicity analyses showed robust neutralizing antibody responses across age strata, confirming the vaccine’s high protective efficacy.

An international, multicenter, randomized trial of the ChAdOx1 nCoV‑19 (AZD1222) vaccine assessed two dosing regimens across 23,848 participants. Overall efficacy after two doses was 70.4 %, rising to 81.5 % against the B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant when the interval between doses was extended to ≥12 weeks. The vaccine exhibited an acceptable safety profile, indicating its utility in diverse epidemiological settings.

### COVID‑19 Vaccine Efficacy in Different Age Groups and Against Variant Strains

In a Phase III, randomized, placebo‑controlled trial involving 2,260 adolescents aged 12–15 years, the BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine demonstrated 100 % efficacy against symptomatic COVID‑19, preventing all 18 confirmed cases in the vaccine arm while none occurred in the placebo group. Safety data indicated a favorable tolerability profile, supporting the use of the Pfizer‑BioNTech vaccine in younger populations. 

Frenck, Ralph W., Nicole Klein, and Nick Kitchin. “BNT162b2 mRNA Covid-19 Vaccine in Adolescents.” *New England Journal of Medicine*, 2021, doi:10.1056/NEJMoa2107456.

The mRNA‑1273 vaccine (Moderna) was evaluated in a double‑blind, randomized Phase III trial of 30,351 adults. Two 100 µg doses administered four weeks apart yielded 94.1 % efficacy against symptomatic infection and conferred complete protection against severe disease. Immunogenicity analyses showed robust neutralizing antibody responses across age strata, confirming the vaccine’s high protective efficacy. 

Baden, Lindsey R., Hana M. El Sahly, and Byron Essink. “Efficacy of the mRNA‑1273 SARS‑CoV‑2 Vaccine.” *New England Journal of Medicine*, 2021, doi:10.1056/NEJMoa2035389.

An international, multicenter, randomized trial of the ChAdOx1 nCoV‑19 (AZD1222) vaccine assessed two dosing regimens across 23,848 participants. Overall efficacy after two doses was 70.4 %, rising to 81.5 % against the B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant when the interval between doses was extended to ≥12 weeks. The vaccine exhibited an acceptable safety profile, indicating its utility in diverse epidemiological settings. 

Voysey, Merryn, Sabine A.C. Clemens, and Shabir A. Madhi. “Safety and Efficacy of the ChAdOx1 nCoV‑19 (AZD1222) Vaccine.” *The Lancet*, 2021, doi:10.1016/S0140-6736(21)00432-3.
